titleStmt.title: [Letter] 1849 Nov. 15, Columbia, Tenn[essee] [to] Col[onel] Joseph Brown, Maury County, Tenn[essee] / W.H.D. Wendel : a machine readable transcription of an image
titleStmt.author: Wendel, W.H.D.

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Letter] 1849 Nov. 15, Columbia, Tenn[essee] [to] Col[onel] Joseph Brown, Maury County, Tenn[essee] / W.H.D. Wendel
bibl.author: Wendel, W.H.D.
bibl.note: This is a letter from W.H.D. Wendel to hi grandfather Col. Joseph Brown dated November 15, 1849. He writes about visiting his grandmother, and local politics.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p:
I reached here to day to dinner— design going out to Grand mother Mills anxious in the afternoon — will continue my journey to
M' boro Murfreesboro
tomorrow, I should be pleased indeed to visit you, but cannot do so, as my time is limited — possibly I may do so on my return home, if I come through here — but I shall most likely return by Nashville —

All were very well when I left, to day week — Mr Brown was reelected by a large majority — the Democratic Ticket prevailed throughout — Present me kindly to Mr Lane & family & for yourself accept the highest regard of
